titleInfo.title: Avalon Hall, David Lipscomb University, Nashville, Tennessee, 1981 April

mods.identifier: Harris Photo 486 Avalon Hall David Lipscomb Apr81

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: An exterior view of Avalon Hall on the campus of David Lipscomb University in Nashville, Tennessee, circa April 1981. It was originally the residential home of David Lipscomb and his wife Margaret (1842-1926). Lipscomb University was founded in 1891 by David Lipscomb and James A. Harding. The campus grounds consist predominantly of the former estate of David Lipscomb, who donated it to the school. It is affiliated with the Churches of Christ. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
